required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective, Non-significant Risk, Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) Care Management Software Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: OPTIVISE Map Concordance Study in DBS for Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate DBS device settings and match with the features of the DBS care management software.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a study done on Parkinson disease subjects who have received the DBS system implanted in their subthalamic nucleus.

primary_outcome.measure: To Characterize the Percentage of Leads in Which the Target Map and the Clinically-derived Activation Map Overlap
primary_outcome.description: The one-sided 95% exact binomial lower confidence bound of the proportion was calculated from subjects with readable images enrolled in the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Additional Study Measure on Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) III Scores
secondary_outcome.description: The summary of UPDRS III medication off score at baseline and the UPDRS III stimulation on/medication off score at follow-up and the change from baseline to 18 months. The UPRS III has a range of 0 - 108.

arm_group.description: Subjects with advanced Parkinson's Disease implanted with Medtronic DBS system in the subthalamic nucleus (STN).

intervention.description: Advanced Parkinson's disease patients implanted with the Medtronic Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) system.

study_pop.textblock: Parkinson's disease patients who have been implanted with the DBS system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with Medtronic Deep Brain Stimulation therapy for idiopathic levodopa responsive Parkinson's Disease
- Patient who has had lead placement in the Subthalamic nucleus
- Patient with pre-op MRI available
- Patient with post-op CT scan available showing placement of the lead
- Patient who has documented improvement of at least 35% on UPDRS III scores from baseline preoperative off medication state compared to post DBS implant stimulation on/medications off
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who has had clinically significant persistent stimulation related adverse effects
- Patient who has evidence of lead migration without lead revision
- Patient with other brain malformations that would make it difficult to process images (ablative surgery in the basal ganglia, resective surgery, brain tumor)

overall_official.affiliation: Parkinson's Disease and Movement Disorder Center, University of Kansas Medical Center

facility.name: Parkinson's Disease and Movement Disorder Center, University of Kansas Medical Center

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Following enrollment but prior to analysis, MRIs were evaluated for readability. Those unreadable were excluded from analysis (N=3).

group.title: PD Patients Implanted With DBS System
group.description: Subjects implanted with Medtronic DBS system for the treatment of Parkinson's disease with leads in the subthalamic nucleus who consented for the study.

participants_list.participants: Subjects with readable images were analyzed and there were 3 subjects with unreadable images.

group.title: Subjects With Advanced Parkinson's Disease
group.description: Subjects with advanced Parkinson's Disease implanted with Medtronic DBS system and with documented improvement of at least 35% on UPDRS III from baseline preoperative off medication to post-DBS implant stimulation on/medication off.

measure.title: UPDRS III scores at baseline
measure.description: Patients with documented improvement of UPDRS III scores of at least 35% were included in the study. A higher score means more motor dysfunction. The score can range from 0 -108.

outcome.title: To Characterize the Percentage of Leads in Which the Target Map and the Clinically-derived Activation Map Overlap
outcome.description: The one-sided 95% exact binomial lower confidence bound of the proportion was calculated from subjects with readable images enrolled in the study.

group.title: PD Patients Implanted With DBS System
group.description: Subjects implanted with Medtronic DBS system for the treatment of Parkinson's disease with leads in the subthalamic nucleus and with readable images.

measure.title: To Characterize the Percentage of Leads in Which the Target Map and the Clinically-derived Activation Map Overlap
measure.description: The one-sided 95% exact binomial lower confidence bound of the proportion was calculated from subjects with readable images enrolled in the study.

analysis.groups_desc: A 95% lower confidence bound was calculated on the percentage of leads where an overlap existed. A subject may have 1 or 2 leads included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Additional Study Measure on Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) III Scores
outcome.description: The summary of UPDRS III medication off score at baseline and the UPDRS III stimulation on/medication off score at follow-up and the change from baseline to 18 months. The UPRS III has a range of 0 - 108.

group.title: Subjects With Advanced Parkinson's Disease
group.description: Subjects with advanced Parkinson's Disease implanted with Medtronic DBS system and with documented improvement of at least 35% on UPDRS III from baseline preoperative off medication to post-DBS implant stimulation on/medication off.

measure.title: Additional Study Measure on Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) III Scores
measure.description: The summary of UPDRS III medication off score at baseline and the UPDRS III stimulation on/medication off score at follow-up and the change from baseline to 18 months. The UPRS III has a range of 0 - 108.

analysis.groups_desc: Summary statistics on the UPDRS III score. A higher score is more motor dysfunction.

reported_events.desc: The protocol for the study did not include safety data collection

group.title: Subjects With Advanced Parkinson's Disease
group.description: The study protocol did not require safety data to be collected for the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
